item.title: Ethereum Classic is Starting to Mobilize - CoinDesk
item.description:
Ethereum Classic is Starting to Mobilize - CoinDesk

Ethereum's original blockchain just won't die. The result of a hard fork of the ethereum network in July, the blockchain has not only survived, but it's evolving into a competing version of the decentralized application platform. Now, supporters of the platform are beginning to mobilize.

item.title: Opair Launches ICO for "Open and Fair" Cryptocurrency
item.description:
Opair Launches ICO for "Open and Fair" Cryptocurrency

Disclaimer: This article was provided by Bitcoin PR Buzz. Bitcoinist is not affiliated with the firms represented by Bitcoin PR Buzz and is not responsible for their products and/or services. Founded by Frank H. Rettig, Opair aims to be a cryptocurrency as well as a platform for crowdfunding, Colored Coins, "decentralized debit cards," private chains, smart contracts, and reputation.

item.title: Digital Currencies Like Bitcoin Could Increase UK GDP by $80 Billion
item.description:
Digital Currencies Like Bitcoin Could Increase UK GDP by $80 Billion

Barely a week after the World Economic Forum published a 139-page report that focused on blockchain all through without a mention of Bitcoin, it has released a Youtube video titled: What would happen if the United Kingdom issued a digital currency like Bitcoin?

item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Here's Our Weekend Scalp Strategy - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Here's Our Weekend Scalp Strategy - NEWSBTC

Here's a look at what we are focusing on in the bitcoin price this evening. This morning, in the first of our twice daily bitcoin price watch pieces, we noted that the week so far had given us plenty to go at, and that this meant we were net up on the markets heading into the final session.

item.title: Japanese Banks Plan Blockchain Currency Exchange - CoinDesk
item.description:
Japanese Banks Plan Blockchain Currency Exchange - CoinDesk

A group of Japanese financial institutions are looking to create a blockchain-based platform they could leverage to cut costs on domestic and foreign exchange services. Announced today, initial members include the Bank of Yokohama and SBI Sumishin Net Bank. Those involved in the effort will work with distributed ledger tech startup Ripple to develop the platform.

item.title: Can we deploy an autonomous contract (or 'smart contract') without blockchain techs?
item.description:
Can we deploy an autonomous contract (or 'smart contract') without blockchain techs?

Just got rejected from my dream school Columbia. I e-mailed my English teacher and told her the disappointing news. This is how she replies: Lily, I am so, so sorry to hear that. But there are a few very important things to remember. First, you haven't let anyone down!

item.title: Why The Windows Secure Boot Hack Is a Good Thing - Bitcoinist.net
item.description:
Why The Windows Secure Boot Hack Is a Good Thing - Bitcoinist.net

If you even casually follow security news, you're aware that the key governing Microsoft Secure Boot has been found, exploited, and Secure Boot as a "feature" has been rendered meaningless. I'm here to tell you that this is a good thing.

item.title: Airbus joined Hyperledger Blockchain Project | HolyTransaction
item.description:
Airbus joined Hyperledger Blockchain Project | HolyTransaction

French airplane firm Airbus joined Hyperledger Blockchain Project, or the Linux Foundation blockchain-related program. Last year Airbus sold more than 1,000 aircraft and now the company is joining the same blockchain project that also sees the participation of firms such as IBM, Red Hat, Intel and JPMorgan.

item.title: Warning! Next Bitcoin Core Version Could be Hacked, Reads Advisory
item.description:
Warning! Next Bitcoin Core Version Could be Hacked, Reads Advisory

The next version of Bitcoin Core, a popular digital wallet for the cryptocurrency, could be hacked and replaced with a malicious look-alike by state sponsored actors, reads a safety warning. On 17 August, open-source project Bitcoin.org announced the threat on its website.

item.title: Chainalysis: More Ransomware Arrests Are Coming - Bitcoin News
item.description:
Chainalysis: More Ransomware Arrests Are Coming - Bitcoin News

Ransomware has been on the rise as of late, and it is a cyber security threat a lot of businesses and government services are taking seriously. According to Chainalysis, the blockchain monitoring company, more ransomware-related arrests from law enforcement are on the horizon.
